info.title: Conversations
info.description: Query and interact with existing Conversation threads, messages, and channels

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived. Default is false.

delete.description: Archives a single thread. The thread will be permanently deleted 30 days after placed in an archived state.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

patch.description: Updates a single thread. Either a thread's status can be updated, or the thread can be restored.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether the thread to update is archived. Default is false. A thread's status property can not be updated if the thread is archived.

requestBody.description: The properties of the thread to update. If restoring a thread, the archived property should be the only field in the request body. For other updates, PATCH requests should exclude the archived property from the body of the request.

get.summary: Get the original content of a single message.
get.description: Returns the complete original text and rich text bodies of a message. This will be different from the text and rich text in the message itself if the message's `truncationStatus` is anything other than `NOT_TRUNCATED`.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the message.

get.summary: Get message history for a thread.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort direction. Valid options are `createdAt` (ascending), and `-createdAt` (descending, default)

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.summary: Send a message to a thread.
post.description: Send a new message on a thread at the current timestamp.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

requestBody.description: The message. `MESSAGE` and `COMMENT` are the valid types of message. Other message types are side-effects of other operations, such as changing a thread's status.
Request, containing list of `ActorId`s to resolve.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Limits results to channel accounts within a particular channel.

parameters.name: inboxId
parameters.description: Limits results to channel accounts within a particular inbox.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the channel.

parameters.name: threadId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the thread.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the message.

failureDetails.errorMessage: There was an issue sending your email

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: actorId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the actor.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Set the sort order of the response. Valid options are `id` (default) and `latestMessageTimestamp` (which requires the `latestMessageTimestampAfter` field to also be set). If you’re filtering threads by `associatedContactId` , you can sort in descending order by prepending - to the sort option (e.g., `-id` or `-latestMessageTimestampAfter` ). Otherwise, results are always returned in ascending order.

parameters.name: inboxId
parameters.description: The ID of the conversations inbox you can optionally include to retrieve the associated messages for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `associatedContactId` property.

parameters.name: associatedContactId
parameters.description: The ID of a contact you can optionally include to retrieve a filtered list of conversations for. This parameter cannot be used in conjunction with the `inboxId` property.

parameters.name: threadStatus
parameters.description: The status of the associated conversations to filter by (either `OPEN` or `CLOSED`). This property must be provided if you’re including the `associatedContactId` query parameter.

parameters.name: latestMessageTimestampAfter
parameters.description: The minimum `latestMessageTimestamp`. This is required only when sorting by `latestMessageTimestamp`.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: channelAccountId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the channel account.

parameters.name: inboxId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the inbox.

id.description: The ID of the channel account.

channelId.description: The ID of the channel that the channel account is an instance of.

name.description: The name of the channel account.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox that contains the channel account.

active.description: Whether the channel account is turned on.

PublicChannelAccount.description: An instance of a conversations channel. Examples include team emails and chatflows. All conversations messages occur on a channel account.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

ActorId.description: The ID of an actor/participant in a conversation.

PublicInbox.description: A conversations inbox, which contains channel accounts and threads.

PublicChannel.description: A conversations channel. Examples include Email, Facebook Messenger, and HubSpot LiveChat.

archived.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

PublicThreadUpdateRequest.description: The properties of the thread to update. If restoring a thread, the archived property should be the only field in the request body. For other updates, PATCH requests should exclude the archived property from the body of the request.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

PublicDeliveryIdentifier.description: An identifier that represents how a message is sent.

integrationAppId.description: The ID of the client if the client is an integration.

PublicClient.description: A client that sends conversations messages.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

closedAt.description: When the thread was closed. Only set if the thread is closed.

latestMessageTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent or received on the thread.

latestMessageSentTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

latestMessageReceivedTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

spam.description: Whether the thread is marked as spam.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox containing the thread.

associatedContactId.description: The ID of the associated Contact in the CRM.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)
